fields.headline: What's new?
fields.bodyText: Sudan crossing Adventure travel operator Guerba (01373 826611; www.guerba.com) has restarted trips to Sudan 15 years after it last sold them. Highlights including the Unesco heritage sites of the Napatan Region form part of a trip from Cairo to Cape Town, starting in August 2006, from £3,395pp. Namibia direct Air Namibia (01293 596654; www.airnamibia.com.na) will introduce direct daily flights between Gatwick and Windhoek from 2 July, from £510 return, making Namibia far more accessible for UK holidaymakers who previously had to fly via Frankfurt. Gay south A gay-friendly Antarctic cruise has been launched by Peregrine Adventures (01635 872300; www.peregrineadventures.co.uk). The company welcomes same-sex couples on its 10-night voyage to the South Shetlands and Antarctic peninsula in December, from £2,510pp. Bournemouth bound Thomsonfly.com (08457 484950) launches flights from Bournemouth to Valencia, Spain, Pisa, Paris, Malaga and Amsterdam on Tuesdays, to Palma on Wednesdays and Faro on Thursdays, from £17.99 one way.
